intro: Gurania subumbellata, commonly known as the clustered gurania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually arranged in clusters, giving it the species name "subumbellata." The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
